clues.text: Be sure to visit this Asian capital's National Stadium, also known as the Bird's Nest, which is almost exactly on the 40th
In the U.S. the 40th parallel north sets the border between Nebraska & this state due south
If you want to stand on the 40th parallel in this capital, go to Ataturk Forest Farm & Zoo; you'll be pretty close
The highest mountains of this Italian island just south of Corsica straddle the 40th parallel
After this river joins with the Jarama River in Aranjuez, Spain at the 40th, it flows on into Portugal

rounds.comments: (Alex: And I'll give you a little heads-up on that.  "Genus" will not be one of the correct responses.)

clues.text: Natasha Henstridge played half-human/half-alien Sil in this movie series
Anjelica Huston & Raul Julia were creepy & kooky in this 1991 film
Rise from the ashes & name this Harry Potter film with a taxonomic title
clues.response: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

clues.text: In a 2008 title Indiana Jones had to deal with this royal realm
clues.response: the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull

clues.text: It's father vs. daughter in the courtroom as Gene Hackman tilts with Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio in this legal thriller

The narrator of "My Antonia" gets quinsy, an inflammation of these in the throat

Swift says Gulliver made "a voyage or two into the Levant", which is on the shores of this sea
Jerry Seinfeld said these 3 letters on a Ford stood for "limited", as in "how many of these damn things we can sell"
It's no myth that Acura introduced this luxury sedan in 1986
You'll look presidential in the Navigator SUV from this brand

In an argument about building Rome, he killed Remus

Believing his beloved Thisbe to be dead, he killed himself with his sword

He was the father of six of the twelve Olympians, including Zeus, Hades & Hera
This city's international film festival presents Golden Space Needle Awards

After this 37-year-old producer died in 1936, the Motion Picture Academy named an award in his honor
The NAACP awarded its Spingarn Medal to this diva in 1965
A rattlesnake named for how it moves, or a person who's a real snake in the grass
These "hooded" snakes are responsible for about 10,000 deaths a year in India
General term for the kind of snake whose squeeze can kill

The largest countries with no snakes are New Zealand & these 2 North Atlantic island nations

Juan Martinez Montanes, a sculptor from this country, was admired for his wood carving
The Marquise de Montespan, a mistress of this "Sun King", was rumored to be involved with witchcraft

This father of Cotton Mather married his own stepsister, Maria Cotton, in 1622

Patience & Fortitude are the 2 lion statues in front of this New York City building
Since 1904 this lion has served as the symbol for Penn State's athletic teams
Confederate general known as "King of Spades" because he made his men dig so many trenches

An attempt to corner the gold market in 1869 resulted in this "day" of financial panic

The story that this ancient Greek poetess drowned herself for love of Phaon is probably untrue

North Dakota's only national park, it's also the only one named for a U.S. President
